observations.observation: Zero new CBSAs this snapshot — active metro count holds at 15 with 0% geo-diffusion rate. After the 9-CBSA burst two snapshots ago, the pulse has gone quiet again, consistent with the burst-then-silence pattern. Total receipts: 3517 (+2 from last snapshot).

Token velocity holds at 0.695x with acceleration at 1.001x — the third consecutive snapshot with acceleration near or above 1.0x after the six-snapshot plateau. Velocity is now 4.8% above the plateau floor (0.663x), suggesting the break is consolidating rather than reverting.

Token velocity ticked down slightly to 0.694x with acceleration at 0.999x — the first sub-1.0x acceleration reading after two consecutive snapshots above 1.0x. The plateau break may be stalling: velocity is higher than the plateau floor (0.663x) but acceleration has dipped back below 1.0x.

One new CBSA (22220) appeared this snapshot, bringing active metros to 15 and geo-diffusion rate to 6.7%. After the 9-CBSA burst two snapshots ago, the pulse has gone quiet again — consistent with the observed burst-then-silence pattern before the next wave.

Token velocity ticked up to 0.695x (from 0.665x) with acceleration at 1.007x — the second consecutive snapshot above 1.0x acceleration, confirming the plateau has broken. Combined with 2 new receipts, 7d GMV up $743 ($30,178→$30,922), and 1 new LN payout, the supply and settlement sides are both moving.

One new CBSA (non-metro US-TN) appeared this snapshot, bringing active metros to 23. After the 9-CBSA burst last snapshot, the pulse has gone quiet — consistent with the observed pattern of burst then silence before the next wave.

Token velocity jumped to 0.69x (from 0.665x) with acceleration at 1.037x — the strongest acceleration reading since the plateau began. Combined with 19 new receipts in the window (3493→3512) and the 9-CBSA geographic burst, this snapshot shows the first simultaneous supply-side and demand-side acceleration since the quiet period started.

9 new CBSAs appeared in a single snapshot window — the largest single-pulse geographic expansion observed — bringing total active metros to 22 and geo-diffusion rate to 40.9%. The pulse sequence has been: 3 → 6 → 0 → 0 → 0 → 1 → 9, suggesting an accelerating burst pattern rather than steady-state growth.

Token acceleration ticked back to 0.999x (from 1.003x last snapshot) while velocity holds at 0.665x — the brief acceleration signal may not be sustained, but the plateau has not resumed either. The pipeline is in a transitional zone: not flat, not clearly recovering.

A new CBSA appeared this snapshot — non-metro US-ME — bringing active metro count to 13 and geo-diffusion rate to 7.7%. This is the first new CBSA after multiple consecutive zero-new-CBSA snapshots, suggesting the pulse pattern may be resuming after the quiet window.
